Fair Division Algorithms

Explore different algorithmic approaches to fair division, from simple two-player procedures to complex multi-party mechanisms.

Divide-and-Choose

Beginner 2 Players

The most fundamental fair division procedure. One player divides, the other chooses. Guarantees both proportionality and envy-freeness.

Properties:

  • ✓ Proportional
  • ✓ Envy-free
  • ✓ Strategy-proof for divider
Time: O(1) cuts • Space: O(1)
Try Interactive Demo

Last Diminisher

Intermediate n Players Coming Soon

Extends divide-and-choose to multiple players using a sequential diminishing process. Each player can reduce the current piece size.

Properties:

  • ✓ Proportional
  • ? Envy-free
  • ✓ Finite procedure
Time: O(n²) cuts • Space: O(n)

Selfridge-Conway

Advanced 3 Players Coming Soon

First discrete algorithm to achieve envy-freeness for 3 players. Uses a sophisticated trimming and allocation strategy.

Properties:

  • ✓ Proportional
  • ✓ Envy-free
  • ✓ Finite cuts
Time: O(1) cuts • Space: O(1)

Algorithm Comparison

Algorithm Players Proportional Envy-Free Cuts Required Difficulty
Divide-and-Choose 2 ✓ ✓ 1 Beginner
Last Diminisher n ✓ ✗ ≤ n(n-1)/2 Intermediate
Selfridge-Conway 3 ✓ ✓ ≤ 5 Advanced

Recommended Learning Path

1

Start with Foundations

Learn about fairness criteria and basic concepts.

2

Master Divide-and-Choose

Understand the fundamental two-player algorithm and its properties.

3

Practice with Exercises

Solve problems to reinforce your understanding.

4

Explore Advanced Algorithms

Tackle multi-player procedures and complex fairness guarantees.
